item.title: offline decentralized single sign-on in the browser
item.description:
Recently, browsers have just begun to implement web cryptography. This means that browsers are now capable of the same kind of password-less decentralized authentication schemes we’ve had server-side with ssh and asymmetric keys for decades.

I think this is super interesting. I wonder if users are going to be able to understand how to use it tho. I do want to try.
